name: Chicken Satay with Homemade Peanut Sauce
author: HANZOtheRAZOR
summary: This simply marinated chicken tastes just delicious, especially when paired with this spicy peanut sauce for dipping or basting. Fish sauce STINKS, do not let this stop you, the end result is a beautiful flavor!
ingredients: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1/2 inch strips
2 small red chile peppers, seeded and minced
12  wooden skewers, soaked in water for 1 hour
directions: Toss chicken, garlic, ginger, and 1 tablespoon fish sauce in a bowl until the chicken is coated in the marinade
While the chicken is marinating, heat the peanut oil in a skillet over medium heat
Stir in shallots, garlic, ginger, and chile peppers
Cook and stir until the shallot begins to turn golden brown, about 7 minutes
Reduce heat to low, and stir in peanut butter, coconut milk, soy sauce, brown sugar, 1 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce, and lime juice until blended
Simmer very gently for 10 minutes, then remove from heat and keep warm
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil grate
Grill chicken skewers on preheated grill until no longer pink in the center, about 3 minutes per side
